Key Match Events: Malik Monk scored 31 points, leading the Sacramento Kings to a 138-133 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies.
DeMar DeRozan added 29 points for the Kings.
De’Aaron Fox contributed 23 points for the Kings.
Jaylen Wells scored 30 points and Jarren Jackson Jr. added 28 for the Grizzlies.
Scottie Pippen Jr. gave the Grizzlies a brief lead with two free throws at the 7:56 mark of the fourth quarter.
The Kings went on a 20-10 run to regain the lead, capped by a 3-pointer from Malik Monk with 4:21 remaining.
Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion and contributed nine points and seven rebounds off the bench.
Ja Morant and Marcus Smart did not play due to injuries.
Keegan Murray missed his second straight game for the Kings due to left ankle soreness.
Kings guard Devin Carter made his debut after undergoing left shoulder surgery last July.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings dished out 21 assists in the first half, with three players having four or more assists.
The Grizzlies tied the game 100-all on two free throws by Jarren Jackson Jr. with 1:27 left in the third quarter.
The teams combined for 150 points in the first half, with the Kings shooting 52.7% and the Grizzlies shooting 52%.
The teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter, with the Kings making 10 of 18 and the Grizzlies making 7 of 11.
